intro: Isocoma wrightii, commonly known as Wright's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its globular shape, with numerous small, yellow flowers clustered at the top of its stems. It has gray-green, fuzzy leaves and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Isocoma wrightii is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
